result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Apfel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond applied. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.
Court grants good time. Must report to jail on or before June 3, 2016.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas A Apfel in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond. Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State makes recommendation. Defense relates. 

Court relates and orders: 
5 days jail with good time - Must report to jail on or before 6/3/2016. 
Costs - 60 days to pay. Bond to be applied. 

Jail faxed.

Defendant Nicholas A Apfel in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Raymond relates agreement has been reached but requesting 30 days.  Court relates.  State relates and moves to amend to misdemeanor failure to report to jail 946.425(1m)(a).  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Court grants amendment.  Guilty plea entered.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas A Apfel in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Reset.
Bond to continue.  



  Plea hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas A Apfel in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Nicholas A Apfel in custody.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense's Motion to Dismiss. Attorney Raymond withdraws motion. Defense does not object to an amended information being filed. Amended Information filed by State. Formal reading waived. Not guilty plea entered. 

JAIL FAXED  Plea hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas A Apfel in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense motion to dismiss to be scheduled.
  Motion hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
of Attorney Ryan J Raymond in Support of Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.

Defendant Nicholas A Apfel in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Nicholas A Apfel in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case reset.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas A Apfel in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Formal reading wavied. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

07/07/2015: THIS CASH BOND IS ADJUSTED FROM $2,500.00 DOWN TO $500.00 CASH BOND.  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant Nicholas A Apfel in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Nicholas A Apfel in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Raymond relates Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant.  Court accepts waiver, finds probable cause, and binds defendant over.
Attorney Raymond relates and requests bond modification from $2,500.00 cash bond reduced to a cash bond of $500.00.  Argument by State.  Argument by Attorney Raymond.  Court grants bond modification to $500.00 cash bond.  
Defendant to complete serving through tomorrow prior to signing bond.
  
  Arraignment scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Defendant Nicholas A Apfel in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Nicholas A Apfel in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to quash warrant. Court quashes warrant. Defendant to contact PD's office to see if he qualifies. Defendant waives formal reading of Complaint.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
